data.title: Fidus Team
data.meta_description: Our senior team has deep industry sector expertise developed over 300+ years of combined experience investing in and advising lower middle market companies.
data.text:
Will Brown

Managing Director

Prior to joining Fidus Capital in 2016, Mr. Brown was Senior Vice President of Finance of a public REIT where he oversaw all aspects of debt and equity financing for the companyâs development and joint venture activities. Previously, he was a Vice President with Fidus Partners, LLC, an investment banking firm, where he provided merger and acquisition advisory and related services to private equity firms, corporations, and private business owners. Mr. Brown earned a Master of Science of accountancy degree as well as a Bachelor of Science degree in finance, magna cum laude, from the Wayne Calloway School of Business and Administration at Wake Forest University and is a Certified Public Accountant.

Matt Culbertson

Managing Director

Mr. Culbertson has 9 years of experience investing in and providing advisory services to lower middle market companies. Prior to joining Fidus Capital in 2012, Mr. Culbertson was an associate with Fidus Partners, LLC, an investment banking firm, where he provided merger and acquisition advisory and related services to private equity firms, corporations, and private business owners. Mr. Culbertson has transaction experience within several industries including niche manufacturing, business services, and consumer / retail. Mr. Culbertson graduated in 2006 from the McIntire School of Commerce at the University of Virginia with dual concentrations in finance and management.

John Grigg

Managing Director & Investment Committee Member

Mr. Grigg has over 25 years of experience advising clients on mergers and acquisitions. Prior to co-founding Fidus Partners, LLC, an investment banking firm, in 2004, Mr. Grigg served as managing director and partner at First Union Securities, Inc. and its predecessor, Bowles Hollowell Conner & Co., from 1989 to 2000. Prior to joining Bowles Hollowell Conner & Co., Mr. Grigg worked in the investment banking group of Merrill Lynch & Co. Mr. Grigg earned a bachelor of arts from the University of North Carolina and a master of business administration from the University of Virginiaâs Darden School of Business.

John Herring

Managing Director, Chief Operating Officer & Chief Legal Officer

Prior to joining Fidus in 2023, John was a shareholder at Robinson, Bradshaw & Hinson, P.A, a law firm based in Charlotte, NC, where he worked for approximately 29 years. He was the lead attorney and legal advisor for Fidus Capital since it was formed in 2005. He founded the Private Credit Practice Group of Robinson Bradshaw and chaired it for over 20 years until he joined Fidus. John regularly advised business development companies, SBIC funds, and other credit investment vehicles in the structuring, negotiation, documentation, and management of their debt and related equity investments, including the exercise of creditors rights and remedies. John also advised private funds in connection with their formation, capital raising and offerings, management activities, acquisitions, dispositions, and corporate matters. John earned a Bachelor of Science in Business Administration from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, Kenan-Flagler Business School, with a focus on finance. He also earned a Juris Doctor from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill, Law School, with honors, and was inducted into the Order of the Coif.Â

Tom Lauer

Managing Director & Investment Committee Member

Mr. Lauer has more than 25 years of experience investing debt and equity capital in lower middle-market companies. Mr. Lauer was a managing partner of Fidus Partners, LLC, an investment banking firm, from 2008 to June 2011. Mr. Lauer was a managing director of Allied Capital Corporation, a publicly-traded business development company, from 2004 to 2008, where he was a member of the firmâs Management Committee from 2006 to 2008, Private Finance Investment Committee from 2005 to 2008, and Senior Debt Fund Investment Committee from 2007 to 2008. Prior to joining Allied Capital Corporation, Mr. Lauer worked with the Global Sponsor Finance Group of GE Capital, the financial services unit of General Electric, the Leveraged Capital Group at Wachovia Securities and its predecessor, First Union Securities, Inc., a retail brokerage and institutional capital markets and investment banking firm, and the Platform Components Division of Intel Corporation. Mr. Lauer earned a bachelor of business administration from the University of Notre Dame and master of business administration from the University of Notre Dameâs Mendoza College of Business.

Robert Lesley

Managing Director & Investment Committee Member

Prior to joining Fidus Capital 2013, Mr. Lesley was a partner at Chapter IV Investors, a $270 million middle-market hybrid investment fund. Chapter IVâs flexible investment charter allowed for investment in both the private (control and minority equity) and public markets. From 2003 to 2007, Mr. Lesley was a vice president with Blue Point Capital Partners, a private equity firm focused on lower middle-market companies. From 2000 to 2003, Robert was an associate in the Mergers & Acquisitions Group of Wachovia Securities and its predecessor, First Union Securities, Inc. Mr. Lesley earned a bachelor of arts in economics from the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill and a masters of business administration from the Kellogg Graduate School of Management at Northwestern University.

Mike Miller

Managing Director, Head of Business Development & Investment Committee Member

Mr. Miller has over 25 years of leveraged finance and corporate lending and origination experience. Prior to joining Fidus, in 2010, Mr. Miller served in various capacities, including managing director and head of business development, at Allied Capital Corporation from 2005 until 2010. Prior to joining Allied Capital Corporation, Mr. Miller spent more than 16 years with JPMorgan Chase and its predecessors where he worked in their middle market leveraged finance, asset based, and corporate lending groups. Mr. Miller earned his bachelor of science in industrial and labor relations from Cornell University and his master of business administration from The Stern School at New York University.

Craig Petrusha

Managing Director

Mr. Petrusha has more than 20 years of experience investing in lower middle market companies. Prior to joining Fidus Capital in 2013, Mr. Petrusha served as a principal with Golub Capital Corporation from 2010 to 2013, where he was responsible for transaction execution and portfolio management. Prior to Golub, Mr. Petrusha performed various investment related activities at Allied Capital Corporation, GE Antares Capital, Orchard First Source Capital, and Allstate Investments. Mr. Petrusha earned a bachelor of science in accounting from Indiana University and a master of business administration from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.

Jesse Rodriguez

Managing Director

Mr. Rodriguez has 20+ years in principal investing and M&A covering the United States, Europe, Asia and Latin America. Prior to joining Fidus, Mr. Rodriguez served as a Managing Director at Millennium Global, SphereInvest and Bank of America Securities overseeing M&A, special situations and merchant banking. He has also served in leadership roles in industry, including tech and health care. Mr. Rodriguez earned a BA in Economics and Political Science from UCLA and an MBA from Harvard Business School.

Ed Ross

Chief Executive Officer & Investment Committee Chair

Edward H. Ross is the chief executive officer and chairman of our investment advisorâs investment committee. Mr. Ross has more than 25 years of debt and equity capital investing experience with lower middle-market companies. Mr. Ross co-founded Fidus Capital in 2005. Mr. Ross was a managing director and the head of the Chicago office for Allied Capital Corporation, a publicly-traded business development company, where he focused on making debt and equity investments in middle-market companies from 2002 to 2005. Prior to joining Allied Capital Corporation, Mr. Ross co-founded Middle Market Capital, a merchant banking group of Wachovia Securities and its predecessor, First Union Securities, Inc., a retail brokerage and institutional capital markets and investment banking firm. Mr. Ross earned a bachelor of arts from Southern Methodist University and a master of business administration from the University of Notre Dameâs Mendoza College of Business.

John Ross

Chairman & Investment Committee Member

Mr. Ross has over 20 years of experience advising clients on mergers and acquisitions. In 2004, Mr. Ross co-founded Fidus Partners, LLC, an investment banking firm. Prior to co-founding Fidus Partners, LLC, Mr. Ross served as a managing director at Wachovia Securities and its predecessors, First Union Securities, Inc. and Bowles Hollowell Conner & Co, from 1999 to 2002. Mr. Ross earned a bachelor of science from Southern Methodist University and a master of business administration from the Harvard Business School.

Shelby Sherard

Chief Financial Officer

Ms. Sherard has more than 25 years of finance experience. Prior to joining Fidus Investment Advisors, LLC in 2014, Ms. Sherard was a financial officer at Prologis, Inc., a leading owner, operator and developer of industrial real estate, first serving as Chief Financial Officer, Americas, and then overseeing the U.S. tax department. Previously, she served as the Finance Director for Chicago Union Station Development Company, LLC, a real estate development company. From 2005 through 2006, Ms. Sherard served as Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Grubb & Ellis Company, a publicly-traded real estate services company. From 2002 through 2005, Ms. Sherard was the Chief Financial Officer and Senior Vice President of SiteStuff, Inc., a procurement solutions provider for the commercial real estate industry. Previously, Ms. Sherard held positions at Morgan Stanley, LaSalle Partners Inc. and Hewitt Associates, Inc. Ms. Sherard is a CPA and earned a bachelorâs degree from Northwestern University, a master of business administration from the University of Pennsylvaniaâs Wharton School and a masterâs degree in tax from the University of Illinois.

Andy Worth

Managing Director & Investment Committee Member

Mr. Worth has over 25 years of investment experience with the last 20+ years focused on providing debt and equity to companies in the middle and lower middle market. Andy focuses on all aspects of Fidusâ investment process including origination, underwriting and portfolio management; Andy is also a member of Fidusâ Investment Committee. Before joining Fidus Capital in 2008, Andy was a principal in Allied Capitalâs Chicago office. Prior to Allied, Andy held various roles in Credit Suisseâs Global Industrials and Services investment banking group and First Union Securitiesâ Leveraged Finance Group. Andy earned a BA in Political Science from the University of North Carolina and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business.

Allston Moore

Associate

Mr. Moore joined Fidus Capital in 2023. Prior to joining Fidus, he worked in PricewaterhouseCoopersâ assurance practice focusing on financial services and in the Transaction Advisory Services group at Grant Thornton. Mr. Moore earned a Bachelor of Science in accounting from the Darla Moore School of Business at the University of South Carolina as well as a Master of Science of accountancy from the Daniels College of Business at the University of Denver. Mr. Moore is a Certified Public Accountant.

Alex Rogalski

Vice President

Mr. Rogalski joined Fidus Capital in 2023. He started his career at Lazard Middle Market in Chicago supporting sell-side M&A transactions. Prior to joining Fidus Capital, he served as a Vice President at Owner Resource Group, an Austin-based private equity firm, where he focused on evaluating, executing and supporting investments in middle-market companies across a variety of industries. Mr. Rogalski received his bachelor of business administration in finance and economics from the University of Notre Dame and his master of business administration from the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

Will Turner

Associate

Mr. Turner joined Fidus Capital in 2022. Prior to Fidus, he worked as an Investment Banking Analyst in the Technology, Media & Telecom Group at Wells Fargo Securities and in the Equity Capital Markets Group at Truist Securities. Mr. Turner earned a Bachelor of Arts in Economics and Political Science from Boston College. He was also a member of the BC menâs tennis team.

Ron Won

Principal

Mr. Won leads West Coast originations for Fidus Capital and is based in the greater Los Angeles area. Prior to Fidus Capital, he worked in leveraged finance and sponsor coverage at several commercial banks where he had increasing responsibilities during his tenure. Mr. Won earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Science, Technology and Society at Stanford University and was a member of the men's varsity golf team.
